item.title: Point system
item.dc:creator: @C_R_O_O_K_S C R O O K S
item.description:
@C_R_O_O_K_S wrote:

That.
where it creates the packets and where it receives it… like addShort() -> addInt() and getShort() -> getInt().

i thought i described it pretty well;P?

for an example we can take:

player.setKills(p.readShort()); thats how kills is added with Short(). and that was ->unsigned 16bit int which is addShort/65535.

so change all shorts to int like

player.setPoints(p.readInt());

public void sendPoints() { RSCPacketBuilder s = new RSCPacketBuilder(); s.setID(113); s.addInt(player.getPoints()); packets.add(s.toPacket()); }

now thats an example , but its more you have to change from short to int in other singel files…

Read full topic

item.title: Point system
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

[quote=“adu, post:9, topic:319720”][quote author=C R O O K S link=topic=416179.msg3061469#msg3061469 date=1260894567]

Just make them cash in points every 50k.
I don’t think you can really change it to where it can handle it.

Ofc you can fix it…

#Bengina, the client can only handle 50.8k pts, otherwise it goes -538905 or sumthing like that?

i belive you are using unsigned 16bit int which is addShort/65535.
you have to change the data type in the server.
where it creates the packets and where it receives it… like addShort() -> addInt() and getShort() -> getInt().

xEnt have learn me this when i made demon-classic with Rusty… and we added it the same way as equipment stat is added… and we saw the same problem like you have.
[/quote]

This. The max range of an Unsigned 2 byte (16bit) short is 65535, so if you want to send a packet with a number more than the max value, you would need to change your data type to a Unsigned 4 byte (32bit) Int which can hold a max range of 4294967295. And remember, all unsigned data types cant hold number lesser than 0.[/quote]

Could you point my to where this is created as ive looked through :
org\rscdaemon\server\net\packet and org\rscdaemon\server\net\rscpacket
org\rscdaemon\server\packetbuilder and cannot find where it defines the data type as i can see short and long and a minimum size of 4?

Thanks for all the help so far

Read full topic

i belive you are using unsigned 16bit int which is addShort/65535.
you have to change the data type in the server.
where it creates the packets and where it receives it… like addShort() -> addInt() and getShort() -> getInt().

xEnt have learn me this when i made demon-classic with Rusty… and we added it the same way as equipment stat is added… and we saw the same problem like you have.

This. The max range of an Unsigned 2 byte (16bit) short is 65535, so if you want to send a packet with a number more than the max value, you would need to change your data type to a Unsigned 4 byte (32bit) Int which can hold a max range of 4294967295. And remember, all unsigned data types cant hold number lesser than 0.

thats what i pointed out Adu<3
[/quote]

I just wanted to sound smart like you =P[/quote]

item.title: Point system
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

You dont get many per kill it depends what npc you kill how much exp you would get and the rate i have the server set to.

The hole point of a point system is that you can set your stats to what you want - i know you can use ::setstats but thats no fun…
I have a npc atm that tells you the levels you can have when you talk to it by checking the amount of points a player has and the level of the stat he is wanting to change - if he has enough points he can add them to the stat - the npc also checks how many levels he can add by checking the amount of points required - eg -

Test has -
Str - 56
Def - 30
Att - 50
and 20000 points
Test asks the npc to add levels to str - the npc replys that test can add 4 levels to str and sends a new string to test asking how many levels he would like to add 1 2 3 4 or none. If test had enough points he could add 1 2 3 4 5 10 20 50 or no levels to his stats. I currently have the npc on a loop untill test clicks none.

The reason i want the player to be able to carry more points is so a player can go from level one to max level instead of having to trade in points and maxing stats and not being able to gain more points or take away levels and loose points because they cant have them.

Thanks for looking

Read full topic

item.title: Point system
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

Training points in order to trade in for exp - i have a system in place that when you kill an npc you gain points instead of exp you can then trade them for levels/exp or money or remove the levels/exp and add them to another stat like it was on google.com, the problem is a player needs more points for max stats than they can have a one time.

Thanks for looking

Read full topic
